availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John J. Allnutt (Louisville, Kentucky, student, notary public, and attorney)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, student, notary public, and attorney. Kentucky native. Son of William W. Allnutt and Frances Ann Bond Allnutt. Student in Louisville in 1863. Notary public in Louisville in 1864. Attorney in Louisville in 1864.

ab.bibl: Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Louisville, Jefferson County, KY, June 1863, p. 123, (Accessed via ancestry.com); Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 8, p. 22; Find A Grave, "John J Allnut (1842-1881)," Memorial #92291953, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=92291953&ref=acom (accessed March 10, 2017).
